abstract.p: Spain's Banco Santander Central Hispano says profit grew 36 percent in first nine months of year; income rose 1.64 billion euros, or $1.4 billion, and profit from Latin American operations was up 64 percent, to 721 million euros (S)

block.p: Profit at the leading Spanish bank, Banco Santander Central Hispano, grew 36 percent in the first nine months of the year, aided in part by increased earnings from Latin America, where economies are improving. The company said that income rose 1.64 billion euros, or $1.4 billion, and that profit from its Latin American operations was up 64 percent, to 721 million euros. Banco Santander has invested $12 billion in Latin America, where it is the No. 1 bank in assets and competes with a Spanish rival, B.B.V.A.
